page.title: 13POULTON HALL II
page.content: A manorial estate of Poulton (then Poltone) was first recorded in 1093.There remains a seventeenth_century staircase within the house and outside a detatched brewhouse of the same period.In the Eighteenth Century a substantial extension was built including an interesting and unusual library. Subsequent additions include a dining room in the 1840's in the internal angle of the original L_shaped house. The owner of the house, Roger Lancelyn_Green is a notable scholar well_known for his retelling of myths and legends.
